Not talking about the old Rod of Ages changes, either. I'm talking about the pre-season giving it 20 AP in exchange for a 300g increase when, again, items were getting cost increases across the board regardless.

Right now if you use AP and you're against even one non-support with magic damage, you take Abyssal - even if you don't use the aura very well. If you can't use Abyssal's aura well, you could get Rylai's instead.

RoA is weak early as you are forced to dump a lot of gold into health and mana, before being able to utilize those 80 APs.

Mostly because I buy _**every Magic Pen item**_ on him
It works

Its 700 range.
Thanks for correction.

It's really bad on Vel', he's long-range poke/combo mage, every his ability has longer reach than Abyssal debuff aura... 

You'll want 30 MRpen with only one pen item (sorcs). You can reach this treshold by either marks+glyphs of marks+quints, if you got with glyphs you'll have extra damage from AP quints, but if you go with quints you gain 12 MR from glyphs... depends on what is better for you, but i usually go for AP quints...

This treshold is very important because many supports run non-MR glyphs, allowing you to deal true damage (So Sorcs are huge power spike, even more if you get them at same time as level 6... that ult does like 700 total damage at 6), and even if enemy has MR glyphs they're screwed when you get Guise

With Sorcs+Guise+runes+precision+void staff, you deal true damage to targets with less than 80, which is also very important treshold, as both Maw and Abyssal grant 50 MR, so someone without MR runes takes true damage no matter what
Running full MRpen page increases this treshold to 90 MR, but it's not really required...

My Vel'Koz build looks like this:
Dorans Ring (cause there is no MPen item below 500g)
Sorcerers Boots (if I don't have 1600 when I go back)
Haunting Guise (if I have the money)
Void Staff
(Around here I upgrade Guise to Lyandris)
Abyssal Scepter
Ludens/Zhonyas/Rylais (this is situational)

The idea is, to give a sht in all manner on the enemies resistences. Also, Abyssal isn't even that bad on Vel. Despite the aura (which also helps allies and is another help against meelee champions) it provides magic resist and Ap.
It's more of a fun build

Spellblade is better think, it gives more regen and more importantly, gold. It doesn't matter if you go support or mid with it. Also first recall is far less punishing if you have to go b early, its only 500g and it's good item on its own.

No, but his basic scalings aren't very high so you focus on building magic pen
His basic scalings are quite good, but his R scaling sucks badly
well actually the scaling for his abilites are meh. however his scaling with magic pen is pretty dang good.

If you make a sum of his ratios, it's pretty high...for such spammy mage. His Q chunks squishies HEAVILY, especially in mid game and with Luden's. It's not rare to see taking off like 1/3 of Lux' hp with single Q. And that's skill with 1550 range and 4.2s CD!
His W is extremely good with just bit of AP, it can clear waves very safely and it can be compared to Viktor's Beam's waveclear. 
W+E combo is just disgusting if it lands, 670+1.175*AP, it's higher than any ultimate, including Veigar's... at very low cost, pretty low CD and and the best part: it's AOE! 

His R scaling just sucks, it has 1k base damage with 0.6 AP ratio... that means, if you fire it at target with like 80 MR, you need over 1660 AP to double its damage, which is unreachable... but MRpen doubles its damage with just 3 cheap items - sorcs, guise and void staff, making MRpen way to go.

Of course MRpen and CDR will increase Vel's damage output far more than buying AP, but AP is really not wasted on him.

They're actually ~~obscenely~~ bad -- leading to CDR + Magic Pen builds being best on him.

His ratios are: Q - 60%, W - 52.5%, E - 50%, R - 60%.

But his bases are: 205 true damage passive, 240 on Q, 275 on W, 190 E, 900 Ult

Lower CD's on his skills also makes him amazing at kiting alongside getting more passive procs off, leading to an altogether higher damage output than via a full AP build.

Especially since his ult is the best thing about him and it has a low ratio -- building CDR is best for it.

how much is the flat mpen really worth though?


 sorc shoes cost 1100g, you're paying 540 for the 45 movespeed, so thats 560g for the mpen. that means each point of mpen should be worth around  37.33 repeating gold. 

so 20 mpen is worth 746.6 gold. Best case scenario you getting this on all 5 champions on the enemy team, which ill say is unlikely, but the potential gold value of JUST the aoe mpen is **3733 gold**(actually quite possible to do on a tank such as malphite and rammus)
 
so the items *POTENTIAL* value is ~ = 6155.5 gold WORTH OF STATS (calculated using abyssal scepters gold efficiency, and the efficiency of one point of mpen.) Im going admit a mage getting the full value of the mpen is very unlikely, but something this good should be balanced around the best case scenario.

I admit I was a bit snide but I was angered by the delusions that the Boards and a lot of low elo people are holding and I am willing to apologize. The fact that they think that armor penetration is better than magic penetration in terms of accessibility and effectivness baffles me. Do they even notice the rework of Last Whisper last year?

Apart from Jhin, name me one AD champion that can reach more than 500 AD and have stellar scaling like Veigar and Ekko (like his ultimate). There is a reason why you can get more magic resist on an AD item than armor on an AP item. There are plenty of champions whose abilities do not scale with total AD but bonus AD, essentially a worse type of scaling than total AD. So to balance it out, flat armor penetration becomes more easily attainable.

The reason why flat armor penetration is more accessible than magic penetration is that they are in small amount. Youmuu's Ghostblade is the only item that has 20 armor penetration. The rest are all 10. At most you can gather 30-40 (40 is actually hard because it means you need 3 item slots for AD items that provide little to no resistances) flat armor penetration from items. It's an illusion of choice. Comparing one item to another item which bears no resemblance apart from the fact that they share resistances is delusional.

Percentage armor penetration/reduction comes in the form of either bonus armor penetration (which really sucks, compared to pre-reworked Last Whisper), or conditional percentage armor reduction (you need to do physical damage 6 times or use "physical bleed effect" on a single champion in order to reach full potential of the Black Cleaver).

Apart from that every single champion has scaling armor except Thresh (due to his passive). Disregarding Thresh, the lowest attainable base armor at level 18 goes to Gnar, sitting at 66.5 armor (plus he can switch form to gain base armor anyways), but even that value is higher than the highest base magic resist on a champion at level 18 being 53.4, and that's the base magic resist on tanks and melee assassins. More than half of the champions have only 30 base magic resist, like I said before. Void Staff is still in the form of percentage total magic penetration, making it more favorable than Last Whisper and its upgrades.

Therefore, It's relatively easier to penetrate all the magic resist on a champion than to penetrate all their armor on a champion. It is possible to penetrate and reduce all of the armor on a champion but it's not viable (full armor penetration rune page against a squishy champion is possible but very stupid).
